definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Great spirits have always found violent opposition from mediocrities.
sentences.chinese: 偉大的精神永遠會受到平庸的暴力反對。

sentences.english: The old poet decried the mediocrity of today's writing.
sentences.chinese: 老詩人抨擊了現代文體的平庸無奇。

sentences.english: To be ordinary makes us happy; this is the key to its constant popularity.
sentences.chinese: 平庸使我們快樂，這是它長盛不衰的主要祕密。

sentences.english: Until recently, I was reconciled, more or less, to being mediocre for life.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近，我才或多或少地安於這種平庸的生活。

sentences.english: Thou strik'st the dull peasant-he sinks in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 你擊倒了平庸的農民，他沉淪於黑夜。

sentences.english: The mediocre talent just never hits the high notes that the top talent hits all the time.
sentences.chinese: 平庸者就是永遠達不到天才隨時能唱出的高音。

sentences.english: He cannot be accepted forever commonplace, the life of wave cunning nebula is him love most.
sentences.chinese: 他永遠接受不了平庸，波詭雲翳的生活正是他的最愛。

sentences.english: That's why experienced mediocrity almost always trumps talent every time.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲何老練的平庸幾乎每每勝過才華。

sentences.english: Jealousy is the tribute mediocrity pays to achievers.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒是平庸之輩向成就卓越者的讚頌。

sentences.english: Maybe you’re just putting it across in a mundane way.
sentences.chinese: 說不定你只是用一種平庸厭倦的眼光責難它。

sentences.english: Only the mediocre are always at their best.
sentences.chinese: 只有平庸之輩能永遠處在最佳狀態。

sentences.english: The highest state of love can stand the plain is fleeting.
sentences.chinese: 愛的最高境界是經得伏平庸的淌年。

sentences.english: Don't get caught up in the cesspool of mediocrity when it comes to your choice of casual footwear.
sentences.chinese: 不要陷入平庸的糞坑中，當涉及到你選擇休閒鞋。

sentences.english: Over-seriousness is a warning sign for mediocrity and bureau-cratic thinking.
sentences.chinese: 過於嚴肅是平庸和官僚式思維的警告信號。

sentences.english: The first sign that you’re successfully breaking out of mediocracy is feeling unwarranted fear.
sentences.chinese: 當你成功擺脫平庸的第一個符號就是感到無端的恐懼。

definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
to be nothing to write home about (idiom)
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
not having any special skill/without any qualifications
